title: Terrible performance on YouTube, after browser has been running for some time
content:
I've had this issue for years, but it was always something I could live with. The Issue would only appear once every week or so. However, recently the issue seems basically happen on a daily basis.

After Firefox has been running for some time and there's a few other tabs open, The YouTube UI will periodically become completely unresponsive.

Just moving the cursor on top of Youtube will cause 100% + CPU in the Firefox task manager and the page is entirely unresponsive during that time (except video playback)...

This issue has persisted through reinstalls, new profiles and is also present without extensions.

This is a performance Profile of the Issue: https://share.firefox.dev/4kNlhKD

Any tips on how to maybe diagnose this are very much appreciated!
creator: JSC

title: are “web-safe fonts” still important for websites?
content:
Yes, web-safe fonts are still relevant and important for websites, even with the widespread use of web fonts. While web fonts offer a wide variety of typefaces, web-safe fonts ensure a consistent and reliable user experience, particularly for users with older devices or slower internet connections. They serve as a crucial fallback, guaranteeing that your website’s text is readable and accessible to everyone.

Font Sonic

title: What with these HUGE cookie file sizes?
content:
I took a look today and I had 237 MB in cookies! This was after clearing the cache of all files. I've only had this (new) machine a couple months.

Short version: Sites have "cookies" from 200kb to as much as 34MB! For many of the sites over 3MB I have no account and have visited them only briefly.

To be clear, I don't care about the space being used. It's trivial. But what the heck is FFox storing and calling it "cookies"? Last I checked, a site was still limited to 4K size cookies and perhaps 50 per domain. So how are we getting to MB+ sized "cookies" per site? Again, the cache was cleared, so what's left aside from trivial cookie files of <4KB?

Desktop; Windows 11; Firefox 139.0.4 64 bit
creator: MozzieBob

title: captcha on Zazzle.com
